intro: Moronobea ptaritepuiana subsp. neblinensis, commonly known as the Neblin's moronobea, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern New Guinea. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at elevations above 1,500 meters. Its floral structure is adapted for pollination by specific insect species, contributing to its ecological niche. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
